lead_paragraph: The referendum on Britain’s membership in the European Union exposed sharp generational divisions.

byline.contributor: Claire Barthelemy reported from London, and Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura from Edinburgh. Iliana Magra and Hannah Olivennes contributed reporting from London.
byline.original: By CLAIRE BARTHELEMY and KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA

headline.print_headline: Young Britons Feel Left Out as Generations Split
headline.main: Among Young Britons, Fear and Despair Over Vote to Leave E.U.

snippet: The referendum on Britain’s membership in the European Union exposed sharp generational divisions.
abstract: Many young people living in Great Britain worry about how European Union referendum will affect their future; many express anger that their parents and grandparents would seek to limit travel, exposure to other cultures and opportunities to work and study abroad, all features EU membership has afforded them.
